Articles.Content:
Hi all, thought it about time I stopped lurking and started posting

After playing around (lots) with this incredibly awesome game, I finally managed a stable Munar landing using Ivan Ivanovich\'s Stock Moon Lander and excellent guide over at http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4137.0 - good job that man!

So, my pride and joy, a snapshot from Jeb\'s holiday

Welcome to the forums!

Congrats on your first Munar landing! Toke me ages to get it to work. >_>

Hehe - had a wobbly moment after touchdown as the lander started sliding off down the slope, and Jeb and the boys ran out of fuel after getting back into Munar orbit... but other than that it was a milk run
The slopes in KSP are trecherous; one wrong move and you\'re tumbling into a pit. >->

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Welcome aboard, and nice landing! It seems you took the wise approach- I\'m still honing my munlanding skills. I\'ve designed rockets that will get me there, but my piloting skills are still a bit rough :-\

Well done! I\'ve made several Munar landing/return missions myself. However I must admit I\'ve not yet done this with stock parts, reason being my poor computer cannot handle the stupendous rockets required and I can\'t stand playing ANY game at 5FPS lol.

That said it\'s running much more smoothly with the 0.13 so maybe I\'ll have to give it another look...

Thing is I love the variety and customisation you can get with mod packs
Welcome to the forums! Nice little ship, but isn\'t it al little unstable with those tanks on the sides?
Not my own ship, it\'s someone else\'s as mentioned in first post - but yeah, was a little unstable and difficult to land on the winglets!
